fifteenpuzzle.datastructure

Class MyMinHeap

  • java.lang.Object
    • fifteenpuzzle.datastructure.MyMinHeap

  • public class MyMinHeap
extends java.lang.Object
    MyMinHeap Class. Implementation of minimum heap for nodes which contains information of certain permutation of puzzle and cost evaluation to solution. Cost evaluation is used to make comparison. This class is used in A*-algorith to select least cost node to continue search. Heap size has to be big enough to get correct answer. 1.000.000 works fine.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyMinHeap(int maxSize)
      Description of Constructor This constructor sets the maximum size for the heap and creates Node[]-array where to put the inserted values.

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        public void insert(Node node)
        Description of insert(Node node). This method adds given node to heap. If heap is full, one hundred parth of the end of the heap is trashed by moving size-variable. This is little bit risky bisness but with big enough heap it works.
        Parameters:
        node - node for added to the heap

      • removeMin

        public Node removeMin()
        Description of removeMin(). This method return head of the heap. That is node which has lowest cost value.
        Returns:
        node with smallest cost.
